name: Beth's Blueberry Bread Pudding
author: Amanda F.
summary: I love bread pudding. I am a fanatic! I go everywhere to just to try the bread pudding. This is one of my favorite bread pudding recipes!
directions: Combine 1/2 cup sugar and 3 tablespoons butter in a saucepan over low heat; cook and stir until butter is melted, 3 to 4 minutes
Stir cream into butter mixture; bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer until golden sauce is slightly thickened, 5 to 10 minutes
Pour golden sauce into a bowl and cover with plastic wrap
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Beat 3/4 cup sugar and 3 tablespoons softened butter together in a bowl using an electric mixer until smooth and creamy
Add eggs and vanilla extract; beat until fluffy, 2 to 3 minutes
Slowly pour milk into butter-egg mixture while continuing to stir until evenly combined
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Place bread cubes in a large bowl
Pour milk mixture over bread; let stand until bread is moistened, about 5 minutes
Fold blueberries into bread mixture; transfer to a 3-quart baking dish
Mix 2 tablespoons sugar and cinnamon together in a bowl; sprinkle over bread mixture
Drizzle 1/3 cup golden sauce over bread mixture
Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted in the center of the bread pudding comes out clean, about 35 minutes
Serve bread pudding with remaining golden sauce
